p: Antimicrobial activity was assessed as described in our previous study [ 64, 65]. In brief, two-fold serial dilutions of the agents were prepared in DMSO using sterile 96-well microdilution plates with flat-bottom wells. Antibiotics ciprofloxacin and miconazole were used as positive control for bacteria and fungi, respectively. For bacteria, 5% DMSO was used as the solvent control for all the experiments, while for C. albicans, 2% DMSO was used. The MIC was calculated by IC 50/IC 90 Laboratory Excel Calculation Tools and expressed as IC 50 as developed at the University of Antwerp ( http://www.leishrisk.net/leishrisk/userfiles/file/kaladrugr/sops/lab/labsop18_ic50tool.pdf).
